archetype_name: Family Hands-Off Sheet Pan & Slow Cooker Nights
name: Sheet-Pan Kofta-Style Meatballs with Peppers, Zucchini & Tahini Yogurt
description: Family-friendly Middle Eastern–leaning beef meatballs roast on a sheet pan with colorful veggies. Serve warm pitas and a tahini yogurt drizzle for an easy, hands-off dinner.
prep_steps: Heat oven to 220°C/425°F. Line a large sheet pan with foil or baking paper.
Dice 2 bell peppers and 2 courgette into bite-size pieces. Slice 1 red onion into wedges. Rinse 2 cups cherry tomatoes.
Finely grate 1 small onion for the meat mixture. Mince 3 cloves garlic. Chop 1/2 cup parsley.
Have 6 pita bread and 1/2 cup tahini yogurt drizzle ready.
cook_steps: In a bowl, combine 800 g minced beef, grated onion, minced garlic, 2 tsp cumin, 1 tsp coriander, 1 tsp paprika, 1/2 tsp salt, 1/2 tsp black pepper, and half the chopped parsley. Mix just until combined.
Form 16 golf-ball-sized meatballs and place on one side of the sheet pan.
On the other side, toss peppers, courgette, red onion, and cherry tomatoes with 2 tbsp olive oil, 1/2 tsp salt, 1/4 tsp black pepper, and 1 tsp oregano. Spread in an even layer.
Roast for 20 minutes. Rotate the pan and gently turn the meatballs and vegetables. Roast 5–10 minutes more until meatballs are cooked through (internal temp 71°C/160°F) and vegetables are tender.
In the last 3–4 minutes, place pita bread on the oven rack to warm.
Transfer meatballs and vegetables to a platter. Drizzle with tahini yogurt drizzle and sprinkle remaining parsley. Serve with warm pitas and lemon wedges.
instructions: Heat oven to 220°C/425°F. Line a large sheet pan with foil or baking paper.
Dice 2 bell peppers and 2 courgette into bite-size pieces. Slice 1 red onion into wedges. Rinse 2 cups cherry tomatoes.
Finely grate 1 small onion for the meat mixture. Mince 3 cloves garlic. Chop 1/2 cup parsley.

In a bowl, combine 800 g minced beef, grated onion, minced garlic, 2 tsp cumin, 1 tsp coriander, 1 tsp paprika, 1/2 tsp salt, 1/2 tsp black pepper, and half the chopped parsley. Mix just until combined.
Form 16 golf-ball-sized meatballs and place on one side of the sheet pan.
On the other side, toss peppers, courgette, red onion, and cherry tomatoes with 2 tbsp olive oil, 1/2 tsp salt, 1/4 tsp black pepper, and 1 tsp oregano. Spread in an even layer.
Roast for 20 minutes. Rotate the pan and gently turn the meatballs and vegetables. Roast 5–10 minutes more until meatballs are cooked through (internal temp 71°C/160°F) and vegetables are tender.
In the last 3–4 minutes, place pita bread on the oven rack to warm.
Transfer meatballs and vegetables to a platter. Drizzle with tahini yogurt drizzle and sprinkle remaining parsley. Serve with warm pitas and lemon wedges.
